intro: Agihalid, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Agihalid is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
